page.title: 10Growing Christmas trees
page.content: Among the many conifer tree plantations are areas of young{Norway {Spruce}which are grown for sale in {December}as{Christmas trees. By doing this the owner of the woodland can get some return on his investment more quickly than waiting for the woodland to mature. The trees are usually{bought as {seedlings}from a forestry nursery and planted early in the year. It is important that they get{enough rain after planting. The trees are also at risk from{animals}and{fire. In December, after a few years growth, they are harvested. Most growers cut them down because this costs less but if they can be dug up they can be replanted in a garden after Christmas. The trees are{sold by length}and cost over a{pound a foot.
